intro: Ranunculus pulchrifrons, commonly known as the beautiful-eyed buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, bright yellow flowers with deeply lobed petals that resemble a cup, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. It prefers well-drained, moist soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a vibrant splash of color to its natural environment.
